item.title: Initial Release
item.outcome: This was the initial release of iWisdom.

item.title: Corrected JVM Dependencies
item.outcome: Version 1.00 could only be run on Java 1.5. For Mac users, this meant it could only be run on Mac OS X 10.4. This has been corrected, and iWisdom can now be run on Java 1.4, and on Mac OS X 10.3.

item.title: Corrected Intermittent Launch Error
item.outcome: iWisdom sometime refused to launch due to an initialization problem. This has been corrected.

item.title: Added Speech as a Source Type
item.outcome: Added "Speech" as a valid Source Type.

item.title: Import Options Expanded
item.outcome: An import tab has been added. Two new XML import formats are now supported: the Quotation Markup Language (QML), and the Quotation Exchange Language (QEL). In addition, xml formats can now be imported from a Web URL, as well as from a local file. PortableWisdom.org, for example, now has <xml> links that can be used for imports.

item.title: Automatically Check for Later Version
item.outcome: The program can now check to see if a later version of iWisdom is available. On the Prefs Tab you may now check or uncheck a box to check this automatically whenever the program is launched. Just below the check box, a button is available to request that the version be checked immediately. An active Internet connection is required to check the latest version. If a newer version is available, you will be given an option to visit the Version History page in your Web browser. From there, you may proceed to the Downloads page if you would like to download the newer version.

item.title: Added Ability to Generate RSS Feed
item.outcome: Added the ability to generate an RSS Feed. A new Collection tab allows you to specify information about the collection as a whole: information needed as part of an RSS feed. The date created is also captured for each wisdom item, allowing the wisdom to be sorted by this creation date, and adding another field needed for an RSS Feed. The default theme, portablewisdom1, now generates an RSS feed of the most recent five items added to the collection.

item.title: Added Ctrl-W or Cmd-W command to resize window
item.outcome: In some cases, when using a computer with varying display configurations, iWisdom could "remember" where it was last positioned and end up not visible with the current screen configuration. In these cases, pressing Ctrl-W (on Windows systems) or Cmd-W (on Mac systems) will return the window to a standard size and location so that it will be visible.

item.title: Corrected Null File Import Error
item.outcome: Corrected a "Null File" message that was erroneously being generated when trying to import an XML file from a Web URL.

item.title: Make First Name First clearer
item.description: Make it clearer somehow that author's names are to be entered first name first (Albert Einstein, not Einstein Albert).
item.outcome: Added a Tool Tip to Author field on the Edit Tab, to clarify that names are to be entered first name first.

item.title: Make it possible to drop fields from list
item.description: Provide some way to drop fields from the List tab. Some people only want to see author's name and the body of the quotation, for example.

item.title: Change title of body from Description to Body
item.description: Body of quotation shows up as "Description" in when transferring and accepting.
item.outcome: Changed some references to the Body of the item from "Description" to "Body".

item.title: Alternate ways to indicate direct quotations
item.description: Provide some way(s) (other than by providing the quotation marks yourself) to indicate direct quotations.
item.outcome: The collection tab now allows you to specify that all new items are assumed to be direct quotations. The Edit Tab now includes a check box allowing you to specify that the text entered represents a direct quotation.

item.title: Fix Invalid UTF Characters
item.description: Invalid UTF characters are getting into the XML files.
item.outcome: The XML files created are now stored in UTF-8 format, and non-ASCII characters are converted appropriately.

item.title: Corrected Duplication Problem
item.outcome: Corrected a problem that caused some items to continually duplicate themselves. This was caused by an inconsistency in the way files were named. The I/O routine has been corrected to always use the actual file name (rather than a calculated one).

item.title: Added Author Info Field
item.outcome: Added a new "Author Info" field. This will be appended to the name of the author so that, if you wanted the author to appear as "Steve Jobs, CEO of Apple", you would enter "Steve Jobs" in the Author field, and "CEO of Apple" in the Author Info field.

item.title: Prevented Program Crash when iWisdom is removed from its folder
item.outcome: Program will now launch successfully even if it is removed from its enclosing iWisdom folder.

item.title: Corrected Source Link Problem
item.outcome: Fixed a problem that was preventing the Source Link field from being editable.

item.title: Added Web Log and Web Page as Source Types
item.outcome: Added Web Log and Web Page as Source Type values.

item.title: Changed Method of Generating HTML
item.outcome: iWisdom now automatically generates the HTML equivalent for each wisdom item directly, without use of XSLT. This change provides greater ability to precisely control the HTML presentation.

item.title: Body of iWisdom Item is now fully editable HTML
item.outcome: The body of the iWisdom item is now stored, displayed and edited as XHTML.

item.title: HTML character entities now generated automatically.
item.outcome: When generating HTML, certain characters appearing in the body of an item are now converted to their appropriate HTML character entities. Pairs of consecutive hyphens are now changed to em dash characters; double quotation marks are converted to "curly quotes"; and apostrophes/single quotation marks are converted to their curly equivalents.

item.title: Added Tips
item.outcome: When first installed, iWisdom will now show Tips in a separate window each time that it is launched. These can also be requested from the Help Menu. Automatic display of these upon launch can be turned off (or back on) on the Prefs tab, as well as in the Tips window itself. The next tip will be displayed each time iWisdom is launched. The user may scroll through the tips in either direction.

item.title: Favorites Added to Import Tab
item.outcome: A Favorites drop-down menu has been added to the Import Tab. Select an Internet source for importable wisdom from the drop-down menu, then click on the Import button to import all items from the selected source.

item.title: Added iWisdom Import Sources to Help Menu
item.outcome: A new item has been added to the Help Menu, titled iWisdom Import Sources. Selecting this item will cause a Web page to be loaded in your browser. The Web page will list a number of available Import sources for your collection of quotations.

item.title: Add and Remove Quotes
item.outcome: Menu Items have been added that will allow quotes to be added or removed from the current quotation, or from all quotations in your collection. These functions allow you to fairly easily decide to display your quotations with quotation marks, or without (depending on your personal inclination).

item.title: Fixed Code that was Generating Malformed HTML
item.outcome: Corrected several bugs that were causing malformed HTML to be generated.

item.title: Fixed Bug that was Dropping the Author Link
item.outcome: Fixed the problem that was causing the author link to be dropped.

item.title: Redesigned User Interface
item.outcome:
Redesigned the iWisdom User Interface to make it more closely adhere to normal user expectations. Removed several windows from the string of tabs that existed before and put them in more logical locations, with the locations in some cases being dependent on the OS on which the application is run. The changes are described going from right to left along the old string of tabs.

The About tab is now available on the Mac at the iWisdom menu / About item, and on Windows at the Help menu / About iWisdom item.

The Log tab is now available from the Window menu / Log item, on all operating systems.

The Prefs and View tabs are now available from a tabbed Preferences window, which is available on the Mac at the iWisdom menu / Preferences item, and on Windows at the Tools menu / Options item.

The Export and Import tabs are now available as separate windows from their respective items under the File menu, on all operating systems.

The four remaining tabs are now split between two different panes. The List and Category tabs are on the left/top pane, and the Display and Edit tabs are on the right/bottom pane (a new check box under General Preferences allow you to choose you to split the panes horizontally or vertically). The first two panes act as selection panes, and the last two allow you to view/edit a single, selected item.

What used to be known as the Rotate button is now called the Scan button, and has been moved to the tool bar. Clicking once begins the process of showing a different item in the Display window every few seconds, and clicking again on the same button now ends the scan.

Additionally, a search field has now been added to the toolbar, followed by a Find Button.

item.title: Created Backup and Revert to Backup items on the File Menu
item.outcome: New items on the File menu now allow the user to create a backup file, and to revert their current collection to a previous backup file.

item.title: Text File Import Improved
item.outcome: The import function for text files has been improved in several ways. On a Mac, you may import a file simply by dragging and dropping the file onto the application. The ability to parse the text files and accurately identify authors, quotations, years and categories has been improved, although the extent to which this will work well for any individual text file is hard to predict, due to the variation in formatting used within these sorts of files.

item.title: Fixed Spacing Problem
item.outcome: Corrected a problem with proper spacing after use of embedded inline HTML within a paragraph.

item.title: Added Markdown Export Format
item.outcome: Added the ability to export a collection into the Markdown text format.

item.title: Added Linkable ID Number
item.outcome: Each item is now assigned a unique ID number when it is added to a collection. When publishing a collection to a Web site, a shortcut file is generated for each item in the collection, with each shortcut file redirecting to the actual HTML file at the longer URL location. The shortcut file is designed to provide a shorter URL that can be used to reference a Wisdom item.

item.title: Enhanced Import Capabilities
item.outcome: Enhanced the Import function to detect duplicate entries, and to add new information from the imported duplicate, if available.

item.title: Corrected Item/Duplicate Problem
item.outcome: Corrected bug in Item/Duplicate processing. Starting with version 1.60, when a new item is added, its text is compared to that of existing entries and, if a duplicate is found, the new entry is merged with the old one, rather than being added. Unfortunately, when an item was requested to be duplicated, the second occurrence of the item was being merged with the first, resulting in no change. This was corrected by changing the body of the new item to some standard text referring to the duplication. This allows the user to duplicate an entry in order to avoid rekeying author and source information for multiple entries from the same source.

item.title: Added Horizontal Line Below Body in Display View
item.outcome: At the request of a current user, added a horizontal rule between the body text and the remaining information for a wisdom item, on the Display view. This provides some nice visual separation between the primary information above and the secondary information below.

item.title: Added Support for Multiple Categories
item.outcome: The program previously supported multi-level categories (separated by periods) but support has now been added for multiple categories, separated by commas (each of which may have one or more levels). When viewing items from the Categories tab, an item with multiple categories will appear multiple times, once for each assigned category.

item.title: Category Selection Made Easier
item.outcome: A list of categories already used now drops down automatically when your cursor enters the Category field. You may click on an item in the list to select it, or you may type enough of the desired Category to see it selected on the list, then press Enter/Return to select the currently highlighted entry from the list. The process may be repeated, after typing a comma, to assign multiple Categories to an item.

item.title: Enhanced Display Preferences
item.outcome: Added several check boxes to the Display Preferences tab of the iWisdom General Preferences to allow unused fields to be suppressed. Title, Source, Source Type, Date Added and ID Number can all now be suppressed if desired from appearing on the Display tab.

item.title: Expanded Category Replace Function
item.outcome: Expanded the Category Replace function to allow an existing category to be removed (by leaving the replacement category field blank) and to allow a new category to be added to all items (by leaving the existing category field blank).

item.title: Export by Category
item.outcome: A new option has been added to the Export function, to allow all items having the specified category to be exported.

item.title: Split Edit Tab into Three Sections
item.outcome: The fields to be entered on the Edit tab have been split into three lower-level tabs: Content, Author, and Work. Only the information on the Content field is required. This change allows all fields to be accessed for data entry without requiring an excessive size for the iWisdom window.

item.title: Added Bibliographic Fields
item.outcome: Added the name of the work's publisher, the city in which the publisher operates, and the pages of the work from which the extract was taken. All of these fields now appear on the new Work tab. With the addition of these fields, enough data is now maintained to generate a bibliography.

item.title: Author may now be Selected from a List
item.outcome: When entering the Author(s) for an item, the user is now presented with a list of all authors already part of the collection. A particular author may be entered by scrolling through the list presented, or entering enough letters (either last name first, or first name last) to uniquely identify an entry. Pressing Return/Enter selects an author from the list. Pressing Tab moves to the next field. When selecting an existing author, additional author fields (Info and Author Link) are entered automatically on the new entry, if present on any of the existing entries for the same author.

item.title: Source may now be Selected from a List
item.outcome: When entering the Source for an item, the user is now presented with a list of all sources already part of the collection. A particular source may be entered by scrolling through the list presented, or entering enough letters to uniquely identify an entry. Pressing Return/Enter selects a source from the list. Pressing Tab moves to the next field. When selecting an existing source, additional source fields are entered automatically on the new item, if present on any of the existing items for the same source.

item.title: Additional Export Formats Now Supported
item.outcome: The Export window has been reformatted, and additional Export formats are now supported. The user may now select between exporting "All Fields" and exporting a Wisdom List. The All Fields option supports formats that contain all fields for each item in a format that can be read by iWisdom or another program, while the Wisdom List option is formatted using HTML, some equivalent markup format, or OPML. Item Scope allows the user to select only the currently selected entry, all items in a selected category, or the entire collection. The available Formats depends on the chosen Field Scope, but now includes Markdown and Textile formats when Wisdom List is selected. Finally, the destination for any of these choices may now be either an output file, or the System Clipboard (allowing the results to be subsequently pasted into another program).

item.title: Fixed Bug Affecting New Users
item.outcome: Version 1.80 introduced a fatal bug affecting new users. This change corrects that problem.

item.title: Added a separate set of HTML files for Mobile use
item.outcome: When saving a wisdom item, a separate HTML file for use by mobile devices such as iPhones will be generated.

item.title: Java 5.0 Now Required
item.outcome: The minimum requirement to run iWisdom has been upgraded to 5.0 or better, to avoid potential problems with earlier Java releases.

item.title: Wrong Item Deleted from Category Tab
item.description: When deleting from the Category Tab, the item below the selected one disappears.
item.outcome: Corrected a bug that caused problems when deleting an item from the Category Tab.

item.title: Program Loops When Cancelling out of a File / New Menu Item
item.description: After selecting File / New, and then cancelling the action, the program loops interminably.

item.title: Streamlined Documentation
item.outcome: Removed the Tips and am instead providing a single help document to replace the multiple forms of help that were available previously, both to avoid potential user confusion and to make the documentation easier to keep up-to-date.

item.title: Paragraph Tags No Longer Required
item.outcome: The body of a wisdom item no longer displays or requires HTML paragraph tags. Blank lines between paragraphs will now be preserved and have essentially the same effect.

item.title: Registration Now Required for Complete Functionality
item.outcome: Converted iWisdom from donationware to shareware, so a registration fee is now required to achieve full functionality.

item.title: Added to List of Valid Source Types
item.outcome: The list of valid Source Types on the Work tab has been augmented by the addition of Letter as a valid source type.

item.title: Improved Display Appearance
item.outcome: Spacing is now provided between key elements of the wisdom Display in order to make the wisdom item easier to read. Logically related elements are now also combined on a single line, in some cases, rather than using a separate line for each field.

item.title: Added an OK Button
item.outcome: Added an OK button to the toolbar that can be clicked when a user is done editing an item. This does nothing more than clicking on the Display tab, but the lack of an explicit button to indicate the completion of editing seemed to cause some users confusion.

item.title: Added Transfer Prefererences
item.outcome: A fourth Tab has been added to the iWisdom Preferences, titled "Transfer." This refers to the existing Transfer function available from the Item menu. The new Preferences tab allows the user to choose between several different formats for transferring wisdom to the clipboard: Fortune, Markdown, OPML and Text Block (the only choice available previously). The effects of the choice on the currently selected wisdom item will be displayed within the Preferences pane, so that the user can immediately see the effects of their choice.

item.title: Fortune added as Export Format
item.outcome: Fortune is now available as one of the available formats for Export of a Wisdom list.

item.title: Last Author and Work can now be Copied
item.outcome: The Item menu now has a Last Author and Work command, with a shortcut key, that will copy the author and work information from the last item accessed before the one currently being added/edited. This feature makes it easier to add a number of quotations from the same source, since you now need to enter this information only for the first item.

item.title: Improved Views
item.outcome: The View list is now initialized with two named Views, By Author and By Title. Also, views are now retained and conserved as new Wisdom lists are opened.

item.title: Numeric Title Now Retained
item.outcome: In previous versions, attempts to enter numeric titles would result in the title being set to the first few words of the body, as if the title had been blank. This has been changed, and numeric titles will now be retained.

item.title: Ability to Import from WikiQuote
item.outcome: Added the ability to import quotations from WikiQuote.org, using a new item under the File menu. While not all WikiQuote quotations may be able to be imported, due to variations in the way WikiQuote pages are formatted, the new function should work well on most WikiQuote pages.

item.title: Reminder Window added for Unregistered Copies
item.outcome: For users with unregistered copies of iWisdom, a new panel pops up when the application is launched, giving the user options to purchase a license, enter a registration code, or continue in demo mode.

item.title: Publish Function Improved
item.outcome: Added a new Publish command, using ctrl/cmd P as the shortcut key. This new system provides more flexibility than the old system used by iWisdom, allowing you to publish your collection as a Web site or E-book, and publish to any location you like (as opposed to generating Web pages automatically within the Wisdom collection folder itself).

item.title: Accept Command now the Update Command
item.outcome: Renamed the Accept Command to the Update Command. The Update command (with ctrl/cmd U as the shortcut key) is now the command to use to paste an entire item from the system clipboard into your current iWisdom collection. This freed up the P shortcut key for the new Publish function.

item.title: header.xml location change
item.outcome: The header.xml file, used to store information about a wisdom collection, is now stored directly within the wisdom folder, rather than within the xml folder.

item.title: Added TV Show, Interview and Remarks as potential source types
item.outcome: Added Television Show, Interview and Remarks as new source types.

item.title: Removed XML Namespace References
item.outcome: Removed namespace references from XML representations in order to simplify the XML markup.

item.title: Multiple Wisdom Storage Options
item.outcome:
The user now has multiple options for the organization and format of his or her wisdom collection. These are all visible from the Info Window, accessible from the File / Get Info menu. The first option is format. The first possible choice here is "XML", which is the default, and has historically been the only possibility. The second, and new, possible choice is "Text - Structured". Selecting this choice will result in files with the ".txt" extension, using a subset of YAML as a storage format. The next option is whether to organize your wisdom items in a series of folders, named for authors and their works, or simply in a single top-level folder. The third option is whether to name your files using the titles of the items, or simply by sequential numbers.

In particular, if you choose the Structured Text format, without folders, and with files named by Item Number, you will end up with a folder of files that can be pretty easily synced to "the Cloud" and/or to other devices, and then created/modified edited using any text editor.

item.title: Added Backup Prefs
item.outcome: A Backup Tab on the iWisdom Preferences now allows the user to choose how much help he or she wants in remembering to perform backups. The app now defaults to occasional reminders.

item.title: Minor Adjustments
item.outcome: Several bug fixes and minor interface improvements.

item.title: Clarified Handling of Duplicates
item.outcome: Provided additional clarification, both in the user interface and in the user guide, to indicate how and when duplicates are handled.

item.title: Corrected Source Type Issue
item.outcome: Corrected issue that could sometime result in losing the source type for an item.

item.title: Cleaned up Item Tabs
item.outcome: Previous design had Display and Edit tabs on top, with Content, Author and Work tabs below, for editing. These have been combined into a single row of tabs for an item: Display, Content, Author and Work, with the edit mode implicit for the last three tabs.

item.title: Display Prefs Take Effect Immediately
item.outcome: When modifying the font, font size, font color or background color in the Display Prefs, the effect of the change is now shown immediately in the Display tab for the currently selected item.

item.title: Miscellaneous Bug Fixes
item.outcome: Squashed several minor bugs.

item.title: Released as Open Source
item.outcome: Released as Open Source Software under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.
